title: What we're hearing after the NFL trade deadline: Intel on the Jets, Cowboys, WRs on new teams
content: What's the fallout from the Jets' blockbuster trades? What about other moves that did or did not happen around the league? We have the latest.

title: Winners, losers of a wild trade deadline: Solak weighs in on Jets, Cowboys and Jakobi Meyers
content: Well, things escalated quickly. Which teams made the best -- and worst -- moves before the trade deadline?

title: Boozer takes over game after Scheyer's challenge
content: After failing to score in the first half, Duke freshman Cameron Boozer rallied to finish with 15 points and 13 rebounds -- 10 of those after halftime -- as the Blue Devils overcame a 33-32 halftime deficit to beat Texas in the Dick Vitale Invitational.

title: Jets GM thrilled for 'value' in 2 blockbuster deals
content: Jets GM Darren Mougey said the trades of defensive cornerstones Sauce Gardner and Quinnen Williams did not represent "a teardown," stating instead, "The goal is always to win."

title: White: UFC met with FBI after suspicious betting
content: UFC CEO Dana White said the promotion is working alongside the FBI on an investigation into unusual betting activity ahead of last Saturday's fight between Isaac Dulgarian and Yadier del Valle.

title: LPGA to sanction Saudi-backed Vegas tourney
content: Saudi Arabia finally has a deal with American golf under an agreement announced Wednesday for the LPGA Tour to co-sanction a PIF Global Series event at prestigious Shadow Creek in Las Vegas next spring.

title: Ohio St., IU, Texas A&M, Alabama top CFP ranking
content: In the first rankings of the College Football Playoff, coach Ryan Day and unbeaten Ohio State topped the list, followed by Big Ten foe Indiana at No. 2 with Texas A&M third and Alabama landing at four.

title: Venus to start 33rd pro season at Auckland event
content: Tennis great Venus Williams plans to play for a 33rd straight season on the WTA Tour, starting in Auckland in January as a hint that she is preparing for the Australian Open later that month.

title: Magic's Bane tossed after firing ball at Okongwu
content: Desmond Bane was ejected Tuesday after committing a hard foul on Onyeka Okongwu and firing the ball at the Hawks' center while he fell to the floor.

title: Strong, Fudd lead new-look UConn over Louisville
content: Led by stars Sarah Strong and Azzi Fudd, defending champion and preseason No. 1 UConn picked up where it left off Tuesday against No. 20 Louisville, earning a 79-66 victory in the first women's Armed Forces Classic matchup.

title: Five key questions that will shape the 2026 women's NCAA bracket
content: The SEC race and Big Ten's nonconference performance could have the biggest impact on the women's NCAA bracket.

title: The real Azzi Fudd?  'None of you have seen it'
content: The Most Outstanding Player of last year's Final Four is ready to level up for the Huskies' repeat bid.

title: Sauce Gardner traded?!? Barnwell on the Colts' risky all-in move and what comes next
content: The Colts shocked the NFL by dealing two first-round picks and Adonai Mitchell to the Jets for Sauce Gardner. But is this the right time to get aggressive?

title: Jets trade Sauce Gardner to Colts: Last piece to Super Bowl puzzle? What's N.Y. thinking?
content: The 7-2 Colts are going all-in on a Super Bowl run, while trading the CB was just part of the Jets' busy day.

title: New-look New York: Can this version of the Knicks win the East?
content: These aren't your Thibs-era Knicks. Is that a good thing? ESPN's NBA insiders dive into New York's uneven 4-3 start.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Most impactful newcomers on all 30 teams
content: NBA insiders break down the most impactful player, rookie or coach and where all 30 teams stack up in this week's power rankings.

title: Early MLB offseason rumors and buzz: Which stars will get traded? Which teams will rule the winter?
content: Will Skubal be dealt? Who could sign Schwarber and Tucker? Here's what we're hearing as the 2025-26 hot stove ignites.

title: From Kyle Schwarber to Alex Bregman: Best fits for top free agents
content: Free agency starts Thursday at 5 p.m. ET. Here are some pairings we'd love to see as this winter gets underway.

title: How the Blue Jays nearly took down a baseball superpower -- and how it could change MLB
content: Toronto almost dethroned the mighty Dodgers by prioritizing contact. Will other teams follow the model?

title: 'Are you serious?': How the LSU band got a 66 year-old tuba player
content: This season hasn't gone according to plan for LSU, but one member of the school's band is living his dream.

title: Who makes the Olympic hockey cut? Roster predictions for U.S., Canada, more
content: The NHL is back at the Games (Feb. 11-22). Here's a look at which players will make the cut for the big five.

title: How the Kraken's Joey Daccord uses VR for goalie excellence
content: Sense Arena is the first NHL/NHLPA-licensed virtual and mixed-reality platform, and players are using it to train.

title: Last Dance: Playoffs will define the MLS legacy of Inter Miami's Fantastic Four
content: With Jordi Alba and Sergio Busquets retiring after the season, it's time for Inter Miami's cast of former Barcelona standouts to put up or shut up.

title: USWNT big board: Girma, Rodman injuries cloud 2027 World Cup plans
content: If the 2027 World Cup started today, which players would be on the UWSNT roster? Jeff Kassouf takes a look at who is -- and who isn't -- going to make the cut.

title: Liverpool-Real Madrid reaction: Reds' resurgence continues, Trent's unhappy return to Anfield, more
content: Liverpool turned in their best performance of the season vs. Real Madrid in the Champions League, as Trent Alexander-Arnold faced his old club for the first time.

title: Trade deadline buzz: How will Shaheed fit into Seahawks offense after trade?
content: Fantasy football impact of every NFL trade deadline deal, including Jakobi Meyers and Rashid Shaheed.

title: Matchup rankings: Upgrade Wan'Dale Robinson, downgrade Kimani Vidal
content: The most and least favorable matchups for this week's games at the four key positions: QB, RB, WR and TE.

title: Is now the best time to trade Austin Reaves?
content: A closer look at Austin Reaves' incredible early-season production, and whether it's wise for fantasy managers to trade him now.

title: Women's boxing divisional rankings: New No. 1 at junior middleweight
content: Mikaela Mayer is ranked in two divisions following her win over Mary Spencer at 154 pounds. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid plot Vinícius Júnior exit
content: Vinícius Júnior's days at Real Madrid could be numbered. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 'Chopped, buried under kitchen': Chilling details of Gujarat horror; wife on the run
content: Ahmedabad Police unearthed a chilling murder plot, finding a man's remains buried beneath his kitchen floor. His wife, allegedly in league with her lover and his relatives, is accused of killing him nearly a year ago. The couple reportedly plotted the murder after the victim confronted his wife about an affair.

title: 'Misleading the nation': Haryana CM rebuts Rahul's 'H-Files'; calls Cong 'agenda-less'
content: Haryana chief minister Nayab Singh Saini and Union Minister Kiren Rijiju have refuted Rahul Gandhi's claims of widespread voter fraud during the Haryana assembly elections. Gandhi presented 'H-Files' alleging a theft of 25 lakh votes, including duplicate and invalid entries. Saini accused Gandhi of misleading the nation with lies, while Rijiju questioned the impact of Gandhi's 'atom bomb' allegations.

title: Democrats Trump Donald in first electoral setback for US President
content: Democrats secured significant victories in recent elections, winning governorships in Virginia and New Jersey, and local polls, including New York City. These wins are seen as a rebuke of President Donald Trump's influence, with women and minorities triumphing over Trump-backed candidates. The results signal a potential shift in political momentum.

title: Big test for Trump's tariff war: US SC to decide legalities - what is US admin's Plan B?
content: The Supreme Court is set to hear arguments on President Trump's sweeping tariffs, imposed under emergency powers, potentially altering presidential authority and global trade. Lower courts found the tariffs exceeded executive power, but the administration argues they protect national security. A ruling could impact billions in collected duties and set a precedent for future trade policy.

title: Mamdani's win: New York's new power couple met on dating app; here’s the story
content: New York City welcomes Zohran Mamdani as its first Muslim and Indian American mayor, also the youngest in a century. His modern, millennial-driven campaign, heavily utilizing social media, saw him connect with voters through humor and accessibility. Notably, Mamdani met his artist wife, Rama Duwaji, on a dating app, a testament to his generation's approach to relationships and politics.

title: The OG 'Jan Nayak': Why Karpoori Thakur is the flavour of Bihar elections 2025
content: Bihar's election season sees a fierce battle for the 'Jan Nayak' title, with parties invoking socialist icon Karpoori Thakur's legacy. His emphasis on social justice and humble origins resonates as politicians seek to connect with voters, highlighting a yearning for integrity in politics.

title: UGC NET December 2025: Registration to close on November 7; NTA issues important advisory
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has issued a crucial advisory for candidates yet to complete their UGC-NET December 2025 registration. The deadline to fill the form, pay the fee, and download the confirmation page is November 7, 2025. Applicants must verify all details before payment, as no changes will be allowed post-submission.

title: Karnataka SSLC and PUC exam 2026: Timetable out; check complete schedule here
content: The Karnataka School Examination and Assessment Board has released the final timetable for SSLC and PUC examinations in 2025. SSLC-1 exams are scheduled from March 18 to April 2, 2025, while PUC-1 exams will run from February 28 to March 17, 2025. SSLC-2 exams will take place in May 2025, and PUC-2 exams are set for April and May 2025.

title: Budget Mac coming: Apple may enter low-cost laptop market; first-ever affordability move
content: Apple is reportedly developing a budget-friendly Mac laptop, codenamed J700, to compete with Chromebooks and affordable Windows devices. Expected to launch in early 2026 for under $1,000, it will feature an iPhone processor and an LCD display, targeting students and casual users. This move aims to expand Apple's PC market share amidst growing competition.

title: No Virat, Rohit! BCCI announces India A squad for SA series; Gaikwad vice-captain
content: Tilak Varma will lead the India A squad against South Africa A in a three-match unofficial ODI series, with Ruturaj Gaikwad as his deputy. Ishan Kishan and several T20 regulars feature in the 14-member team, while Shreyas Iyer is sidelined due to injury. The series will be held in Rajkot from November 13-19.

title: Gold-plated bat and ball for Richa Ghosh after Women's World Cup glory
content: Cricket Association of Bengal will honor Richa Ghosh with a gold-plated bat and ball at Eden Gardens for her stellar Women's World Cup performance. Ghosh, who scored 235 runs at a tournament-high strike rate, is recognized for her invaluable contribution to Indian cricket. This felicitation aims to inspire young girls across Bengal.

title: Muslim, socialist & more: 5 reasons why Trump's Maga hates NYC Mayor Mamdani
content: New York has elected Zohran Mamdani, a Muslim, African-born democratic socialist, as its youngest mayor in over a century. His victory, celebrated by progressives, is seen as a significant challenge to MAGA ideology, embodying cultural shifts and progressive policies that alarm Donald Trump and his supporters.

title: After $12.6 billion Amazon stake cut, Jeff Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie Scott makes one of her biggest donations
content: MacKenzie Scott has gifted Howard University a remarkable $80 million, one of its largest donations ever, bolstering diversity and equity initiatives. This substantial, unrestricted contribution will aid student aid, infrastructure, and operations, arriving at a crucial time for the institution. Scott's ongoing philanthropic spree includes significant gifts to other DEI causes and a reduction in her Amazon holdings.

title: Pant returns! India name Test squad for South Africa series
content: Rishabh Pant returned to India's Test squad for the series against South Africa starting in Kolkata, replacing N Jagadeesan. Pant proved his fitness with a strong performance for India A against South Africa A in the warm-up fixture. Key players will join the Test squad after the Australia T20Is, while Kuldeep Yadav gets early preparation time in Bengaluru.

title: 'You are Hindu': Pak denies entry to 7 Indians; part of Sikh 'jatha'
content: An Indian national and six family members were reportedly denied entry into Pakistan to join a Sikh pilgrimage for Guru Nanak Dev's birth anniversary. Pakistani officials allegedly cited their Hindu faith as the reason for refusal.  Seven other Indian nationals from Lucknow also faced similar rejection at the border, despite completing formalities.

title: IND vs SA: Can South Africa end 25-year wait for a Test series win in India?
content: The Temba Bavuma-led side will look to script history by securing South Africa’s first series win in India since Hansie Cronje’s team triumphed in the 1999-2000 season. The two-match series begins on November 14 in Kolkata.

title: Awkward! Tejashwi-Tej encounter at Patna airport goes viral - watch
content: Estranged brothers Tejashwi and Tej Pratap Yadav had an unexpected airport encounter ahead of Bihar's assembly elections. While Tejashwi greeted YouTuber Samdish, Tej Pratap watched silently, later stating he was "doing fine" when asked about their strained relationship. The viral clip highlights the political and personal rift within the family.

title: 'Dhoom Machale': How Mamdani channelled his inner Indian after NYC victory — watch
content: Zohran Mamdani celebrated his historic New York City mayoral victory with a vibrant rally, quoting Jawaharlal Nehru and promising ambitious plans to tackle the cost-of-living crisis. His win marks him as the city's first Muslim mayor, first of South Asian heritage, and youngest in over a century, embodying a message of hope.

title: 'A benchmark': Watchdog FATF hails ED; lauds agency's asset recovery efforts
content: The Financial Action Task Force (FATF) acknowledged India's success in recovering public assets lost to financial crimes. A notable case highlighted involves land confiscated by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) being identified for a new public airport, demonstrating effective asset recovery and societal benefit.

title: 'Acting superior': Indian man assaulted in Canada; video sparks outrage
content: A disturbing video from Toronto shows an alleged drunk man assaulting an Indian individual in a cafe, sparking outrage and renewed fears of xenophobia. This unprovoked attack, where the aggressor hurled insults, follows a recent fatal assault on an Indian-origin businessman in Edmonton. Both incidents highlight growing concerns over immigrant safety and racially motivated violence across Canada.

title: End of the road for Mohammed Shami? Veteran pacer snubbed again for South Africa Tests
content: Rishabh Pant's return to the Indian Test squad for the South Africa series is a major highlight. However, Mohammed Shami's continued exclusion, despite strong domestic form, sparks debate about his future. Selectors appear to be prioritizing younger pacers, hinting at a potential transition in India's bowling attack.

title: Travelling alone on shoestring budget: Making of India's 90th GM Ilamparthy
content: Thirteen-year-old Ilamparthi, initially an uninvited guest at a chess camp, has now become India's 90th Grandmaster. Guided by GM Shyam Sundar Mohanraj, his journey, despite financial hardships and family challenges, is marked by exceptional talent and unwavering discipline. The young prodigy's dedication promises a bright future in the chess world.

title: From Brazilian model to Saddam Hussain — What Rahul alleged in 'H-files' presser
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the Election Commission and BJP of a conspiracy to manipulate Haryana's election results, alleging 25 lakh duplicate, non-existent, or manipulated voters. He presented evidence of "vote chori" across five categories, including a Brazilian model voting multiple times under different names. Gandhi claimed the EC refused to use its software to detect discrepancies, suggesting complicity with the BJP.

title: Stralink debuts in India: Maharashtra becomes first state to ink deal; to boost rural connectivity
content: Maharashtra has become the first Indian state to partner with Elon Musk's Starlink for satellite internet services. This collaboration aims to bring high-speed internet to rural and remote regions. The initiative will deploy satellite internet in government institutions and underserved districts. Starlink's entry into India is set for a commercial launch by early 2026.

title: Trapped in gridlock, helpless father walks with sick child in arms
content: A father carried his sick daughter through heavy traffic in Uttar Pradesh after their ambulance became stuck. The heartwarming video shows the man navigating congested roads, sparking outrage over emergency response and traffic management. Social media users demand immediate action to improve traffic flow and prioritize emergency vehicles. The incident highlights critical challenges faced by citizens during emergencies.

title: 'Why his atom bomb never explodes?' BJP slams Rahul's 'H-files' expose - watch
content: Union minister Kiren Rijiju has dismissed Rahul Gandhi's "vote chori" allegations regarding the Haryana polls, questioning the Congress leader's repeated claims. Rijiju highlighted internal dissent within the Haryana Congress, with party leaders admitting to poor performance due to infighting, making Gandhi's accusations unbelievable.

title: Sense of humour, knowledge of MS Office - requirements of becoming Afghan cricket coach
content: The Afghanistan Cricket Board is seeking a new head coach, listing sense of humour and proficiency in Microsoft Office as key requirements. This comes as current coach Jonathan Trott expressed frustration over a lack of input in squad selection and communication with ACB management.  The board's unusual job descriptions have drawn public reaction.

title: Jaipur highway horror revisited: Dumper driver admits drinking twice
content: A dumper driver, Kalyan Meena, arrested for mowing down 17 vehicles and killing 13 in Jaipur, was reportedly drunk. Police confirmed 13 fatalities after initial confusion. Authorities are reviewing traffic management, vowing a crackdown on drunk driving and encroachments. The driver's license is being permanently revoked.

title: Air purifiers giving reality check to Delhi's AQI? Netizens take to social media; point at difference in reading
content: Delhi-NCR faces severe air pollution. Air purifiers reveal alarming filter conditions, indicating dangerous air quality. Netizens share stark differences between official AQI data and their devices. Even iconic landmarks like India Gate are obscured by smog. Regions like Noida and Gurgaon also experience high pollution. Authorities implement measures, but experts warn of chronic issues.

title: Vedant Birla–Tejal Kulkarni wedding: Urvashi Rautela & celebs bless newlyweds
content: Vedant Birla, son of industrialist Yashovardhan (Yash) Birla and Avanti Birla, tied the knot with Tejal Kulkarni, daughter of Sanjeev and Supriya Kulkarni, on November 2 in an intimate ceremony attended by close family members and friends.The couple later hosted a lavish wedding reception which saw the presence of several Bollywood celebrities, industrialists, and politicians who came together to bless the couple.

title: Chucarosaurus diripienda: Giant dinosaur that shattered roads & redefined titanosaurs
content: A colossal titanosaur, Chucarosaurus diripienda, unearthed in Patagonia, measured 30 meters and weighed tens of tonnes. Its immense size even cracked a road during transport, highlighting its incredible bulk. This discovery offers new insights into how these giants evolved, moved, and survived, challenging previous notions of their agility and strength.

title: 'Don't drag Army into politics': Rajnath flays Rahul; row erupts over '10%' remark
content: Defence minister Rajnath Singh criticised Rahul Gandhi for his remarks on the Army, accusing him of attempting to politicise the armed forces and create anarchy. Singh emphasised that soldiers follow 'Sainya Dharma' above all divisions, refuting Gandhi's claim that the top 10% control the Army and that 90% from backward communities are excluded from power.

title: Andhra ashram school headmistress suspended for making students massage her legs
content: An in-charge headmistress at a tribal ashram school in Andhra Pradesh was suspended after a video surfaced showing students massaging her legs. The incident, which occurred about 10 days prior, sparked outrage and led to immediate action by authorities. A senior lawyer condemned the act as misconduct and exploitation of children.

title: 'Why are you silent?' Priyanka urges voters to kick out NDA govt; backs Rahul's 'H-files'
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra strongly backed Rahul Gandhi's "vote theft" claims in Haryana, urging citizens to recognize their power and remove the ruling government. She accused the NDA of destroying everything and called for action against alleged election manipulation. Rahul Gandhi presented "H-Files," alleging widespread irregularities and a compromised election commission, warning of destroyed democratic foundations.

title: 'Why no Congress agents raised objection?' EC questions Rahul's allegations
content: Rahul Gandhi alleged a massive vote theft in Haryana, claiming 25 lakh fake voters and questioning the Election Commission. The EC countered, asking why Congress booth agents didn't raise objections during electoral roll revisions. Gandhi presented evidence of duplicate voters and a "Brazilian model" appearing multiple times on the list.

title: Trump sanctions bite! Oil to India, China fall steeply; but can world ignore Russian crude?
content: New US sanctions on Russian crude oil firms are causing major purchasers in China, India, and Turkey to distance themselves, leading to a significant decline in seaborne exports. Refiners are hesitant to accept Russian crude, resulting in increased oil volumes idling at sea and a drop in Moscow's oil revenue.

title: 'There is a bigger picture': Morne Morkel reveals why India rested Arshdeep Singh
content: Bowling coach Morne Morkel explained Arshdeep Singh's rest in the T20I series against Australia was for experimenting with bowling combinations ahead of the T20 World Cup. Arshdeep returned strongly, earning Player of the Match. Meanwhile, Nitish Kumar Reddy was ruled out due to ongoing fitness concerns.

title: Piyush Goyal gives update on India-US trade talks; cites 'sensitive issues'
content: India and the US are making progress on trade talks, with Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal stating discussions on a Bilateral Trade Agreement are "going on very well." Despite positive developments, sensitive issues remain, requiring additional time. Both nations are working towards a mutually advantageous agreement, aiming to significantly increase trade volumes.

title: UP railway station tragedy: Devotees took shortcut to cross tracks
content: Six devotees were killed and several others critically injured after being run over by the Kalka-bound Netaji Express at Chunar railway station. The pilgrims attempted to cross the tracks instead of using the foot overbridge, leading to the tragic accident. Relief and rescue operations are underway, with authorities investigating the incident.

title: It can be very expensive: Indian student in NYC shares experience
content: Indian students are increasingly drawn to New York City for creative studies, with Parsons student Anishka Tewari highlighting the city as a dynamic classroom. While facing challenges like high costs and homesickness, students gain invaluable real-world experience, learn from diverse global perspectives, and develop strong personal resilience, making the demanding journey a significant life lesson beyond design.

title: Cardiac surgeon lists 5 everyday routines to boost longevity and safeguard heart
content: Dr Jeremy London, a cardiothoracic surgeon, reveals five daily habits for a longer life. These include regular exercise, a nutritious diet, sufficient rest, strong relationships, and heat therapy. These practices boost heart health, reduce disease risk, and improve overall well-being. Consistency in these habits is key to a healthier, longer life.

title: Tamannaah Bhatia stuns in Rs 66,300 bustier midi dress; edgy chic outfit perfect for dinner date
content: Marking another such moment of effortless chicness, the actress recently sported a luxurious midi dress that bore a notable price tag of Rs.66,300. Tamannaah dropped this appearance at the launch of a perfume line, endorsed by Samantha Ruth Prabhu, in the city. Read on to learn more about this look right here.

title: ‘We trusted his mother’s word’: Faridabad girl’s stalker shot her days after apologising
content: Police in Faridabad are on the hunt for a 30-year-old man named Jatin Mangla, accused of shooting a 17-year-old student in Ballabgarh. The troubling case unfolded over several months with reports of stalking and harassment towards the victim. Despite attempts at reconciliation by the girl’s family, Mangla's violent actions escalated, leading to a confrontation that resulted in gunfire.

title: 'Forever etched in my skin': Harmanpreet gets inked after India win - unveils tattoo
content: Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur celebrated the historic ICC Women's World Cup 2025 triumph with a special tattoo. The ink features the trophy, the year 2025, and the 52-run victory margin against South Africa. Kaur, who fulfilled a childhood dream, shared her emotional journey and encouraged aspiring cricketers to never stop dreaming.

title: Watch: Zohran Mamdani ends speech with Dhoom Machale track
content: New York City has elected Zohran Mamdani, a 34-year-old leftist and the city's first Muslim mayor. His victory speech, referencing Jawaharlal Nehru and concluding with the Bollywood hit "Dhoom Machale," resonated with supporters and sparked widespread online amusement. Mamdani, who faced significant opposition, vowed to make the city a beacon of hope and a place for working people.

title: State to launch OTT platform to promote Kannada cinema globally: Mehaboob Pasha
content: The Karnataka government will soon launch its own over-the-top (OTT) platform to provide a global stage for Kannada films, said Mehaboob Pasha, Chairman of Kanteerava Studios Limited, at a press conference in Bidar

title: Pakistani officials allegedly stop Hindu pilgrim from joining Sikh jatha for Guru Nanak birth anniversary
content: Amar Chand, an Indian national, says he and six family members were turned back by Pakistan officials after crossing Attari-Wagah border for Parkash Purb celebrations

title: ‘86 projects completed during undivided A.P. helped improve green cover in rural areas’
content: Telangana leader Ponnala Lakshmaiah prays at Tirupati and Srikalahasti temples ahead of his book release

title: Kerala launches KL-90 series for government vehicles
content: As per final notification,  government vehicles will be registered in KL-90 and KL-90D series.  Some numbers will be reserved specifically for Ministers, high-ranking government officials, protocol vehicles, and other designated individuals

title: Sabarimala gold theft: Kerala HC asks SIT to check if TDB officials can be tried under Prevention of Corruption Act
content: Court says every official who authorised, facilitated, or wilfully overlooked the violations of TDB manual and practice on repairs of temple property has aided and abetted the commission of the act

title: Aadhav Arjuna of TVK ‘absconded’ after Karur stampede, cybercrime police tell Madras High Court
content: Appearing before Justice A.D. Jagadish Chandira, senior counsel N.R. Elango says the petitioner vanished and then posted an inflammatory tweet against the State

title: ‘Karthika Pournami’ celebrated with religious fervour
content: Sri Bhramaramba Mallikarjuna Swamy temple in Srisailam attracted the most number of devotees; pilgrims take a holy dip in Patala Ganga and float ‘Kartika Deepams’ in the Krishna river

title: Kerala government silent about new post creation for new medical colleges
content: Apart from a general statement that new posts would be created for the new medical college hospitals (MCHs) in Kasaragod and Wayanad, the government has not given out any details on the number of posts it would sanction

title: YSRCP chief Jagan’s farmers’ outreach a political drama, says BJP Kisan Morcha
content: During YSRCP term, farmers had faced many cyclones, but Jagan neither visited the affected areas nor stood by farmers, says Chigurupati Kumaraswamy

title: Double Shock For Madhya Pradesh Farmers: Rain, And Now Power Supply Cap
content: After unseasonal rain devastated crops across Madhya Pradesh, farmers have now been hit by a second shock - a controversial electricity department order restricting power supply to just 10 hours a day.

title: Over 15 Lakh Vials Of Banned Cough Syrup Seized In Ghaziabad, 8 Arrested
content: In one of the biggest crackdowns on the illegal trade of banned pharmaceutical substances in recent years, Ghaziabad Police and the crime branch seized over 15.7 lakh vials of prohibited cough syrup.

title: Maharashtra Farmer Waits Months For Crop Loss Compensation, Gets Rs 6
content: A farmer from Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar district in Maharashtra on Wednesday claimed to have received only Rs 6 as compensation from the government for the crop losses he suffered as a result of heavy rains and subsequent flooding.

title: France Suspends Shein Website After Row Over Sale Of Child-Like Sex Dolls
content: France's government said it is suspending access to Shein's online platform until the company proves that its content conforms with French law.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla Spun Around For 3 Hours In Space For Micro Gravity Samples
content: Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla had to spin around himself for three hours to extract samples of the micro-gravity experiments he performed during his 18-day stay onboard the International Space Station (ISS).

title: Counting For JNU Students' Union Elections Underway, Results Expected Tomorrow
content: Counting of votes is underway for the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) elections, held on Tuesday amid high enthusiasm and colourful campaigning across the campus.

title: "Many Can Direct Harry Potter But...": Zohran Mamdani's Advice To Mira Nair
content: Acclaimed Indian filmmaker Mira Nair turned down the opportunity to direct Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire on the advice of her then 14-year-old son, Zohran Mamdani.

title: 'Won't Allow Any Khan To Become Mumbai Mayor': BJP Leader After Mamdani Win
content: The mayoral election victory of Zohran Mamdani, 34 - the first South Asian, Muslim and youngest in a century to helm the administration of New York City - has an effect on the other side of the globe in Mumbai.

title: Year After Murder By Wife, Lover, Man's Body Found Buried In Kitchen
content: A year after he was killed by his wife and her lover, a man's remains were found buried inside his house in Gujarat's Ahmedabad.

title: "Man-Eater" Leopard Shot In Pune District, Carcass Shown To Villagers
content: A "man-eater" leopard that had struck terror in Shirur tehsil of Pune district, which has reported cases of human-animal conflict over a month, has been killed by sharpshooters, forest officials said on Wednesday.

title: Alakh Pandey's PhysicsWallah Gears Up For Rs 3,480-Crore IPO Launch
content: Edtech unicorn PhysicsWallah is set to float its initial public offering (IPO) on November 11, targeting Rs 3,480 crore to fuel its expansion and growth initiatives.

title: Zohran Mamdani's Love For "Dhoom Machale" Is Not New. Proof: 2021 Dune Post
content: New York's newly elected mayor Zohran Mamdani's choice to end his victory speech with Bollywood's iconic anthem "Dhoom Machale" may have set social media ablaze but for those who've followed him closely, his affection for the song is hardly new.

title: Once An Auto Driver, Man Spends Rs 31 Lakh On VIP No. Plate For Son's Audi
content: A Jaipur-based businessman who once drove an auto-rickshaw to make ends meet has spent Rs 31 lakh to acquire a VIP registration number for his son's new luxury car.

title: How Mamdani's 15-Day Hunger Strike In 2021 Paved Way For His Mayoral Win
content: Before Zohran Mamdani became New York City's youngest mayor and the first Muslim to hold the office, he was an Assembly member from Queens who went on hunger strike for the taxi drivers in his city.

title: Zohran Mamdani's Unlikely Rise: From Unknown Socialist To New York City Mayor
content: In a classic David vs. Goliath battle, backbench assemblyman Zohran Mamdani defeated former governor Andrew Cuomo to become New York's youngest mayor in more than a century, at age 34.

title: "Woke Up To Screams": Chhattisgarh Train Collision Victims Recall Horror
content: What began as an ordinary evening on Tuesday turned into one of the darkest nights the city of Bilaspur has seen in years. The collision between the Gevra MEMU local and a stationary freight train has claimed eleven lives so far.

title: After Fight With Wife, Man Abandons Son, 10, At India-Bangladesh Border
content: In a shocking incident, a father abandoned his 10-year-old son far away from home at the India-Bangladesh border after a fight with his wife, said the police on Wednesday.

title: In New Scam, Fraudsters Pose As CISF Personnel To Dupe People
content: After digital arrests and investment scams, a new kind of con has come to light in which criminals pose as personnel of the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) to defraud people.

title: Inside Zohran Mamdani-Rama Duwaji's Dubai Wedding With Burj Khalifa Views
content: Zohran Mamdani has won the 2025 New York City mayoral election, by his side throughout the campaign and on election night was his wife, Syrian-American artist Rama Duwaji, who has largely stayed out of the public eye.

title: Why 'Miami Realtor' Is Trending After Zohran Mamdani's New York Victory
content: Zohran Mamdani has defeated Andrew Cuomo and Republican Curtis Sliwa to become the new Mayor of New York City.

title: Andhra Pradesh Governor Abdul Nazeer conferred honorary doctorate by Karnataka State Law University
content: He receives the honorary degree at the 7th convocation held at the University of Agricultural Sciences in Dharwad

title: Tourist’s allegation: BJP, BMS take out protest march in support of Munnar taxi drivers
content: MVD suspends licences and permits of three taxi drivers who allegedly ill-treated the woman tourist. Two police personnel suspended for ‘not providing timely assistance to the tourist.’

title: Final decision on reorganisation of districts soon, says Andhra Pradesh Minister Anagani Satya Prasad
content: The Group of Ministers has held detailed deliberations on various proposals received to improve administrative convenience, and a final decision will be taken after consulting  the Chief Minister, he says

title: Special Intensive Revision: All-party meeting chaired by Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan decides to legally challenge EC decision
content: Representatives of all political parties except the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) supported the decision.  Congress-led United Democratic Front ready to implead in the case in the event of the government approaching the court against the SIR, says Satheesan

title: SAEL Industries to invest ₹22,000 crore in A.P.
content: The firm will invest in renewable energy, biomass, data centres and port development, with a potential to create 7,000 direct and 70,000 indirect jobs

title: Agriculture Department launches rapid roving survey of crops in Kalaburagi district
content: The Department of Agriculture has launched a rapid roving survey to assess the health of major crops grown during the 2025–26 agricultural year in Kalaburagi district

title: Telangana BJP leader says CBI, ED work independently under NDA, questions Congress’ silence on BRS scams
content: Medak MP Raghunandan Rao says law will take its course in ongoing probes into Kaleshwaram Lift Irrigation Scheme, alleged phone-tapping and other scams linked to previous BRS government

title: Diversion of forest land: State Wildlife Board recommends forwarding proposal to NBWL
content: The Standing Committee of the State Wildlife Board, chaired by Environment Minister Eshwar Khandre, decided to recommend the proposal for diversion of 0.976 hectares of forest land

title: Bharath denies rumours of TDP, family collecting money for party tickets
content: Those who stand on top in the party survey will only be chosen for the ticket, says Industries and Commerce Minister

title: Air quality across India worsened in October 2025: CREA report
content: The study found that 255 of 293 Indian cities exceeded the WHO’s annual PM2.5 standard by October, while only 37 surpassed the more lenient NAAQS, indicating a need to revise the 2009 national standards to match global health benchmarks

title: SIT expands probe to cover possible TDB collusion in Sabarimala gold theft case
content: An SIT plainclothes team has reportedly arrived in Sabarimala, apparently to prepare the ground for escorting the accused to the temple to gather further evidence

title: Sacred Sikh reliquary journeys from Delhi to Patna after more than 300 years
content: Jore Sahib, the footwear of the 10th Sikh Guru was established on November 1 at the Takhat Sri Harmandir Ji Patna Sahib; the relics were authenticated by the Union Ministry of Culture via carbon dating

title: Kerala govt. plans a ‘shared ownership’ to resume work on Sathram airstrip
content: The NCC-operated airstrip, damaged in a 2022 landslip, requires 11.5 acres more for further development, but the Forest dept. has declared the nearby areas as reserve forest. The govt. now plans to share the ownership of the family among Revenue, Forest, Disaster Management wings and the NCC

title: KTR challenges CM Revanth to open debate on Hyderabad development
content: BRS leader accuses Chief Minister of using “mean language” during the Jubilee Hills bypoll campaign, claiming it stemmed from “fear of an imminent defeat”

title: Agniveer recruitment rally in Ballari from November 13 to 18
content: An Agniveer recruitment rally will be held at the district stadium in Ballari from November 13 to 18, according to Colonel Vivek Zamindar, Recruitment Officer, Headquarters Recruiting Zone, Bengaluru

title: YSRCP president Jagan Mohan Reddy’s downfall is inevitable, says BJP MLA Adinarayana Reddy
content: Highlighting the NDA government’s development agenda, he says the Amaravati and Polavaram projects will be completed in the next 1,000 days

title: Huge sacrifices made in last 5 years to make Jammu and Kashmir peaceful: L-G Sinha
content: Reiterating his resolve to dismantle the terror ecosystem, the Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha affirmed the commitment to maintaining peace, justice and equity

title: Protest by sugarcane growers enters seventh day in Belagavi
content: A protest by sugarcane farmers demanding higher price for their produce entered the seventh day in Belagavi

title: Plan on anvil to develop Musalimadugu as eco-tourism destination
content: Musalimadugu has potential to develop on the lines of Mudumalai Wildlife Sanctuary in Tamil Nadu, says Collector, after inspecting forested villages in Bangarupalem and Palamaner mandals abutting Koundinya Wildlife Sanctuary

title: Seven arrested for assaulting, blackening government doctor’s face in Madhya Pradesh’s Sidhi
content: Attack on senior government doctor sparks outrage among healthcare community; accused linked to local right-wing groups

title: AIADMK leader Palaniswami urges party colleagues to remain vigilant during SIR
content: Addressing a meeting of secretaries of the district units of the party at its headquarters in Chennai, Palaniswami noted that the operation was being carried out through employees of the State government

title: Siddaramaiah’s camp mulls AHINDA meet as show of strength amid leadership speculation
content: However, the high command has reportedly told the State Congress leaders not to hold any conventions in support of any party leader

title: As Bihar readies to vote, petitioners in Supreme Court contest the ECI’s claim that SIR 2025 is based on ‘transparent’ 2003 revision
content: While the ECI had referred to the intensive revision of 2003 as a ‘precedent and template’ for the 2025 SIR, the petitioners have raised five ‘basic differences’ between the 2003 intensive revision and SIR 2025

title: Odisha CM announces ₹46,000 crore investment plans for new port, shipbuilding project
content: Paradip Port will be developed with an annual cargo handling capacity of 300 million tons according to ‘Maritime India Vision 2030’ and up to 500 million tons according to the ‘Developed India 2047’ plan, says CM

title: Rice card-holders will be given 1 kg wheat flour for ₹18 from January 2026, says Andhra Pradesh Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar
content: Government has set a target to procure 51 lakh MT of paddy valued at about ₹12,200 crore for kharif season, says the Civil Supplies Minister

title: India, U.S. holding continuous discussions for bilateral trade agreement: Goyal
content: The proposed pact aims to more than double the bilateral trade to $500 billion by 2030 from the current $191 billion

title: Calicut V-C appointment may face legal hurdles
content: A section of the Senate members affiliated to the CPI(M) are planning to approach the High Court against the recent constitution of the search-cum-selection committee by Governor and Chancellor Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar

content: Round-the-clock digital surveillance is in place in view of the huge gathering of dignitaries from all over the world, says Superintendent of Police Satish Kumar

title: Man, waiting on road after van breaks down, killed by truck in Bengaluru
content:
Bengaluru: A 35-year-old dance instructor, who participated in TV reality shows and ran a dance school, was killed after he was knocked down by a speeding truck on Tumakuru Road near Pemmanahalli village Tuesday. The deceased, Sudheendra, had gone to his elder brother's house Monday evening after he purchased a Maruti Suzuki Eeco minivan. He stayed overnight with his brother and was on his way back home Tuesday. Dobbespet police said Sudheendra's new vehicle broke down near Pemmanahalli village on the highway at 7.15am. With the help of commuters, he pushed the van to the extreme left of the road and called his brother. But a speeding truck hit Sudheendra and the van. CCTV footage shows the truck was in the middle lane, but the driver lost control and drove to the extreme left and hit Sudheendra and the van. The truck driver, Pitha Kumar, 22, from Tamil Nadu, has been arrested.

End of Article

title: Week 11 Anger Index: The case for outrage over BYU's and Miami's CFP rankings
